value:
There is too much light here. I cannot
say I find it pleasant.

I served Lady Hel, the ruler of the
dead. To rule the dead, one must
command them.

To have so many Heroes at your
command is not something to be
taken lightly. Impressive, in fact.

A nice stroll near the Death Gate
might do you well. The damp miasma
has a calming effect.

Since I have joined with the Heroes,
I thought I should know their many
histories... I have learned much.

I am here as a representative
of $Nf.$k$pIf you should have any issues with
your dead, I am willing to assist.

What power... This is almost too
much for me to hold back.
Regardless of outcome, we continue.

If Lady Hel were here... This will
not do.

A wise choice. I will see to it that this
is used effectively.

I am Ganglöt. Although I served Lady
Hel, the ruler of the dead... I now am
left to oversee a realm without rule.

I served Lady Hel for a long time.$k$pI was abandoned in the realm of the
dead when I was still very young...$k$pI was full of resentment and hatred
for what had been done to me, but
Lady Hel saved me.$k$pLady Hel would judge the fate of the
dead with a cool, calculated calm,
without the slightest bias.$k$pIn that, she has no equal.$k$pIt is that aspect of Lady Hel that
I wish to emulate—to watch over
all things with unbroken vision.$k$pFree of hate, free of love, selfless.
That is how I want to be.$k$pLady Hel was free of all passion...
Completely.
Death is upon you.
Die and serve.
In Hel's name!
Traitorous!
Lady Hel...
I am Ganglöt. I am the new ruler of the realm of the dead.
I do not recall granting you permission to touch me.
Lady Hel was...magnificent. There will never be another who can rule the dead as she did.
I am more a more appropriate successor to Lady Hel than Princess Eir would be.
I will not stand idle. Give me a task or leave me to my business.
Lady Hel... I hope I can live up to your example...
I am learning much from you and your ability to make consistent use of so many Heroes.
I see.
Do not linger.
Unavoidable.
